title: Is philosophy a better major at college than economics? Why or why not? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well that depends, better for what? My medical doctor and my lawyer both did degrees in Philosophy. I, on the other hand, studied both Philosophy and Economics separately. They wanted to go onto graduate school, I wanted a job right out of undergraduate school. You have to ask yourself what your goals are, and then you can decide what degree is best for you.

It’s the difference between mind expanding and brainwashing. Philosophy will show you lots of different ways of looking at important questions, and show them, at its best, in a way that is difficult and often profound, but clear. Modern neoclassical economics is not a science but an ideology, a series of a priori deductions based on acknowledgedly false premises. It will take a rich and complex area of study and reduces it to thin and mostly unenlightening formulae.
